sen.j: 山村王（やまむらおう、養老6年（722年） - 神護景雲元年11月17日 (旧暦)（767年12月16日））は奈良時代の公卿。
sen.e: Prince Yamamura (722 - December 16, 767) is a Kugyo (a high court noble) of the Nara period.

sen.j: 用明天皇の皇子来目皇子の子孫（皇子の玄孫か）。
sen.e: He is a descendant of Prince Kume, who is a prince of Emperor Yomei (possibly, he is a great-great-grandson of Prince Kume).

sen.j: 天平18年（746年）従五位下。
sen.e: In 746, he was conferred Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 天平宝字元年（757年）従五位上。
sen.e: In 757, he was conferred Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 天平宝字3年（759年）紀伊国国司。
sen.e: In 759, he was appointed as Kokushi (the governor) of Kii Province.

sen.j: 天平宝字7年（763年）正五位下。
sen.e: In 763, he was conferred Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）少納言。
sen.e: In 764, he was appointed as Shonagon (the Minor Councilor).

sen.j: 天平宝字8年（764年）9月11日、太政大臣恵美押勝（藤原仲麻呂）が謀反を起こすとの密告があり、孝謙天皇は山村王を淳仁天皇の居る中宮院に派遣して、皇権の発動に必要な玉璽と駅鈴を回収させた。
sen.e: On October 14, 764, soon after she received an anonymous information about the rebellion by Dajo-daijin (the Grand Minister) EMI no Oshikatsu (he also was called FUJIWARA no Nakamaro), Empress Koken sent Prince Yamamura to Chuguin, where Emperor Junnin was, and she had him collect Imperial Seal and Ekirei bell, which were needed to exercise imperial power.

sen.e: On October 14, 764, soon after she received an anonymous lead about the rebellion by Dajo-daijin (the Grand Minister) EMI no Oshikatsu (he was also called FUJIWARA no Nakamaro), Empress Koken sent Prince Yamamura to Chuguin, where Emperor Junnin was, and she had him collect the Imperial Seal and the Ekirei bell, which were needed to exercise imperial power.
sen.cmt: 密告は、anonymous leadに変更しました。alsoの位置が違います。一部、定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: On October 14, 764, soon after she received an anonymous lead about the rebellion by Dajo-daijin (the Grand Minister) EMI no Oshikatsu (he was also called FUJIWARA no Nakamaro), Empress Koken sent Prince Yamamura to Chuguin, where Emperor Junnin was, and she had him collect the Imperial Seal and the Ekirei bell, which were needed to exercise imperial power.

sen.j: 一説にはこの時に淳仁天皇を幽閉したとも言う。
sen.e: Some people say that Emperor Junnin was confined at this time.

sen.j: これを聞いた藤原仲麻呂は、子の藤原訓儒麻呂に山村王を襲わせ玉璽と駅鈴を奪回するよう命じた。
sen.e: When heard this, FUJIWARA no Nakamaro ordered one of his children, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro, to assault Prince Yamamura and to regain Imperial Seal and Ekirei bell.
When FUJIWARA no Nakamaro heard this, he ordered one of his children, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro, to assault Prince Yamamura and to regain the Imperial Seal and the Ekirei bell.
sen.cmt: Whenの後に藤原仲麻呂を持ってきた方が、文の意味を理解しやすいと思います。一部、定冠詞を追加しました。
sen.e: When FUJIWARA no Nakamaro heard this, he ordered one of his children, FUJIWARA no Kusumaro, to assault Prince Yamamura and to regain the Imperial Seal and the Ekirei bell.

sen.j: 山村王は急報を送り、授刀衛少尉坂上苅田麻呂と将曹牡鹿嶋足が出動。
sen.e: Prince Yamamura sent an urgent message to dispatch Jutoei Shojo (the junior lieutenant of Division of Inner Palace Guards) SAKANOUE no Karitamaro and Shoso (an officer of the Guards Division) OSHIKA no Shimatari.

sen.j: 訓儒麻呂を射殺した。
sen.e: They shot Kusumaro to death by bow and arrow.

sen.j: その後、仲麻呂は平城京を脱出。
sen.e: After that, Nakamaro escaped from Heijo-kyo capital.

sen.j: 近江国で戦いに敗れて滅びた（藤原仲麻呂の乱）。
sen.e: Nakamaro lost the battle and perished in Omi Province (the Rebellion of FUJIWARA no Nakamaro).

sen.j: 君命を果たした山村王を孝謙上皇は喜び、この功により従三位を授かる。
sen.e: Empress Koken was delighted that Prince Yamamura carried out her order, and she conferred Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) on him.

sen.j: 同年10月9日、孝謙上皇は兵部卿和気王、左兵衛督山村王、外衛大将百済王敬福らを淳仁天皇の居る中宮院に派遣して、兵数百でこれを囲んだ。
sen.e: On November 10, 764, Retired Empress Koken sent Hyobu-kyo (the Minister of Military Affairs) Prince Wake, Sahyoe no Kami (the head of Left Guard of the Emperor) Prince Yamamura, Gee-taisho (the General of Outside Guard Division) Kyofuku KUDARANOKONISHIKI, and others to Chuguin, where Emperor Junnin was, and several hundreds of soldiers surrounded it.

sen.j: 山村王が天皇廃位の詔を読み上げ、淳仁天皇は捕らえられ、淡路国へ流された。
